page.title: 06Farming Year-Tamar Valley
page.content: Mr. and Mrs. Tancock, of Tree Farm, keep 76 cows and 60 sheep on their 104 acre farm at Metherell. In summer the animals are kept in the fields and the cows are milked mornings and evenings. Silage and hay are made for indoor winter feeding and crops are sprayed to control weeds. In Autumn the grain is harvested and straw baled for winter bedding for the animals. Potatoes are dug and stored for the shops in the winter. Some of the fields are ploughed and tilled before Christmas and when the days get shorter the animals are all kept under cover. Pipes are lagged to ensure a water supply during the frosty weather. Sheep are kept indoors ready for lambing and waiting for the grass to grow to provide them with food outdoors.
